DOC.brief_title: Venogram vs. Intravascular Ultrasound ( IVUS ) Diagnosing Iliac Vein Obstruction
DOC.criteria: Subject must > 18 < 85 year age Willing participate able understand , read sign inform consent document plan procedure CEAP clinical classification : C4 , C5 , C6 ( enrollment C4 C5 subject cap 50 , least 50 C6 subject enrol ) On duplex ultrasound : patent common femoral vein , patent deep femoral vein , and/or femoral vein study leg Undergoing iliofemoral inferior vena caval venography intent treat obstructive lesion Subject provide write informed consent Previous venous stent implantation involve study leg inferior vena cava Previous venovenous bypass surgery involve study leg Known metal allergy preclude endovascular stent implantation Known reaction sensitivity iodinate contrast manage premedication Subjects pregnant ( woman childbearing potential must negative pregnancy test within 7 day prior enrollment Severe , untreated ( readily treatable ) superficial venous reflux ( great saphenous vein > 7 mm diameter , and/or small saphenous vein > 4 mm diameter ) Acute deep venous thrombosis involve either leg Known history chronic total occlusion common femoral vein study leg . Known history thrombophilia ( e.g. , protein C S deficiency , antithrombin III deficiency , presence lupus anticoagulant , etc . ) Venous compression cause tumor encasement Venous outflow obstruction cause tumor thrombus Life expectancy le 6 month Elevated baseline blood creatinine ( value great upper limit normal range ) Any concurrent disease condition , opinion Investigator , would make subject unsuitable participation study ; example include limited inability lie supine index procedure ( e.g. , severe congestive heart failure ) , thrombocytopenia hematological disorder associate unacceptable risk bleeding , implant orthopedic hardware precludes proper imaging , etc .
